meanings.definition: Friendly or helpful feelings towards others.
meanings.sent1: She always greets her neighbors with a goodwill smile.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together with goodwill to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The goodwill handshake sealed their agreement.
meanings.sent4: Her goodwill nature brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The goodwill atmosphere at the party made everyone feel welcome.

meanings.definition: The established reputation of a business regarded as a quantifiable asset.
meanings.sent1: The company's goodwill grew as customers praised their products.
meanings.sent2: Investors were impressed by the business's strong goodwill in the market.
meanings.sent3: The goodwill of the store attracted more customers than expected.
meanings.sent4: The goodwill of the brand spread far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The company's goodwill value increased steadily over the years.

meanings.definition: A kind, helpful, or friendly attitude towards others.
meanings.sent1: Her goodwill towards her classmates made her popular in school.
meanings.sent2: The community appreciated his goodwill in organizing charity events.
meanings.sent3: His goodwill gesture of offering free tutoring was well-received.
meanings.sent4: The goodwill of the volunteers made the event a success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's goodwill towards students created a positive learning environment.
